custom-block.l: Instansiate a MQTT client - change the broker address with your address Codimeo MQTT broker is offered with no warranty of service and can be down at any time

custom-block.s: MQTT new client for broker %s with options %s

custom-block.l: The client is purged before reaching here... Investigate the good way to do things

block.l: var response, i, header; if (!proc.httpRequest) { proc.httpRequest = new XMLHttpRequest(); proc.httpRequest.open(method, url, true); proc.assertType(headers, 'list'); for (i = 1; i <= headers.length(); i += 1) { header = headers.at(i); proc.assertType(header, 'list'); proc.httpRequest.setRequestHeader( header.at(1), header.at(2) ); } proc.httpRequest.send(data || null); } else if (proc.httpRequest.readyState === 4) { response = proc.httpRequest.responseText; proc.httpRequest = null; return response; } proc.pushContext('doYield'); proc.pushContext();

block-definition.comment: Reports a three-item list containing the latitude and longitude of the user, and the precision of the measurements. Works only if the user allows snap.berkeley.edu access to location data. Some browsers also require an HTTPS connection to Snap!.

block.l: if (!proc.geostarted) { var geo = navigator.geolocation; var cords = []; var options = { enableHighAccuracy: false, }; function success(pos) { console.log(pos); proc.geocords = [pos.coords.latitude, pos.coords.longitude, pos.coords.accuracy]; } function error(err) { alert("ERROR " + err.code + ": " + err.message); } proc.geostarted = true; proc.geocords = null; console.log("starting geolocation") geo.getCurrentPosition(success, error, options); } else if (proc.geocords) { var cords = proc.geocords; proc.geostarted = null; proc.geocords = null; console.log("returning"); return new List(cords); } else { console.log("yielding"); proc.pushContext('doYield'); proc.pushContext(); }

block-definition.s: Store value %'Value' to tag %'Tag' in TinyWebDB
block-definition.comment: Store a value in TinyWebDB service. This is a demo service for Web Services used within Meo-Studio

block-definition.s: Get value for tag %'Tag' from TinyWebDB
block-definition.comment: Get a value from TinyWebDB service. This is a demo service for Web Services used within Meo-Studio

block.l: var mqttScript, done = false; mqttScript = document.createElement('script'), mqttScript.onload = function () { done = true; console.log('MQTT is ready'); }; document.head.appendChild(mqttScript); mqttScript.src = 'https://unpkg.com/mqtt/dist/mqtt.min.js'; return function () {return done; }

block-definition.s: MQTT new client for broker %'url' with options %'opt'

inputs.input: brokermoquitto (ws)=ws://test.mosquitto.org:8080/mqtt mosca (ws)=ws://test.mosca.io/ hivemq (ws)=ws://broker.hivemq.com:8000 mosca-localhost (ws)=ws://localhost:3000 codimeo MQTT ={ ws=ws://mqtt.codimeo.com:15675/ws wss=wss://mqtt.codimeo.com:15676/ws }

block.l: console.log("Client is null") console.log("Options : ") console.log(JSON.stringify(options)) if(!world.mqttClients) { world.mqttClients = [] } for(var i=0; i < world.mqttClients.length; i++) { //First, ensure that all mqtt Clients are ended. //Otherwise, opended websocket will continue pinging world.mqttClients[i].end() } // Then purge the clients' list world.mqttClients.splice(0) client = mqtt.connect(broker, options) console.log("Created new client") console.log(client.options.clientId) client.parent = this options = client.options world.mqttClients.push(client) return client
if(client.connected) { console.log("Client is connected yet") return } client = mqtt.connect(broker, options) console.log("Created new client") console.log(client.options.clientId) return client
client.on(message, function (t,m,p) { console.log("This client :" + this) console.log("Client's parent :" + this.parent) invoke(callback, new List([t, m, p])) })
client.publish(topic, message.toString(), function(err){ if (err) { console.log("err : " + err) } else { console.log("Publish succeeded") } })

console.log(client.options.clientId + " is disconnecting...") client.end(force) world.mqttClients.splice(world.mqttClients.findIndex(function(c) { return client.options.clientId === c.options.clientId }),1)

block.comment: and the main body of the class

block-definition.comment: End MQTT Client with force True or False. Default : False

block.comment: Do not remove this block. It may help to debug your callback

block.l: return listify(JSON.parse(jsonString)); function listify(jsonObject) { if (jsonObject instanceof Array) { return new List(jsonObject.map(function(eachElement) { return listify(eachElement)})); } else if (jsonObject instanceof Object) { return new List(Object.keys(jsonObject).map(function(eachKey) { return new List([eachKey,listify(jsonObject[eachKey])])} )) } else { return jsonObject } }

console.log("Client is null") console.log("Options : ") console.log(JSON.stringify(options)) if(!world.mqttClients) { world.mqttClients = [] } for(var i=0; i < world.mqttClients.length; i++) { //First, ensure that all mqtt Clients are ended. //Otherwise, opended websocket will continue pinging world.mqttClients[i].end() } // Then purge the clients' list world.mqttClients.splice(0) client = mqtt.connect(broker, options) console.log("Created new client") console.log(client.options.clientId) client.parent = this options = client.options world.mqttClients.push(client) return client
if(client.connected) { console.log("Client is connected yet") return } client = mqtt.connect(broker, options) console.log("Created new client") console.log(client.options.clientId) return client
client.on(message, function (t,m,p) { console.log("This client :" + this) console.log("Client's parent :" + this.parent) invoke(callback, new List([t, m, p])) })
client.publish(topic, message.toString(), function(err){ if (err) { console.log("err : " + err) } else { console.log("Publish succeeded") } })

console.log(client.options.clientId + " is disconnecting...") client.end(force) world.mqttClients.splice(world.mqttClients.findIndex(function(c) { return client.options.clientId === c.options.clientId }),1)
